name: overstimulation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being made too excited or interested in something, or a situation in which someone feels like this: Avoid caffeine, daytime napping, and overstimulation in the evening to aid sleeplessness. She turned to escape the overstimulation, but the crowd of people made her passage difficult.
the fact of having too great an effect on the growth, development, or activity of something: Such overstimulation of the economy risks taking us into higher rates of inflation.
biology
  specialized the act of causing a part of the body to produce too much of a particular substance or have too great an effect on a process: Overstimulation of the adrenal gland interferes with cortical levels. The presented symptoms are all associated with overstimulation of the sympathetic nervous system.
